channel.title: [REQ]Port Forwarding... *sigh*
channel.description:
Well, ive been looking for a few days to port forward on my O2 Wireless Box II tried portforward.com aswell, and it seems its pretty much like taking a long walk off a short pier... well anyways, when i do "Attempt" to forward my port it comes up as.
Protocol: UDP/TCP/ANY (i know this part) Port Range "43594" to "43592" *im assuming* Translate to: Now what the hell is this, with my old router ive never had this, and i dont even have a clue what this is tbh. Trigger Protocol, UDP/TCP/ANY Trigger port, 43592 im assuming...
Screenshot: [URL=http://img178.imageshack.us/my.php?image=ll11pt9.png][IMG]http://img178.imageshack.us/img178/8202/ll11pt9.th.png[/img][/URL]
Well, i dont know what the translate part is, ive tried putting my port in the translate part aswell asuming that because there is only a 5 char limit in the box.
Then its asking for to assign a game/application to a device, it has a list of the devices that are connected to my router atm, and i know the "home" one is my laptop which im going to be hosting on (is wireless connected, dunno if this relys on anything) uPnP which i keep enabled i think, well i cant do anything really without it on, i.e; cant connect to other peoples host on xbl etc.
Screenshot #2: [URL=http://img246.imageshack.us/my.php?image=ll2pe1.png][IMG]http://img246.imageshack.us/img246/5638/ll2pe1.th.png[/img][/URL] Well im pretty stumped now. I have Windows Firewall turned off and the ports enabled in the exceptions both UDP and TCP. Any help would be appriciated. Thanks :D

item.title: [REQ]Port Forwarding... *sigh*
item.dc:creator: @doddy doddy
item.description:
@doddy wrote:

Cheers, Never had this problem before, i blame lack of sleep and alcohol!
anyways, applying corrections now…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 17, 2008, 01:04:23 pm[/size][hr]Nah, it still aint working, i dunno if its got anything to do with the fact im using wireless connection or something…
I’ll double check on my exceptions on Windows firewall. And make sure its turned off :|[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 17, 2008, 01:09:59 pm[/size][hr]Aha!, i got it. Got the IP wrong, normally ive got a static ip 93.96.xxx.xxx etc, but that was with the ethernet cable, with wireless its different, thanks everyone

Read full topic

Crossed my fingers mate =p Good luck

item.title: [REQ]Port Forwarding... *sigh*
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“doddy, post:1, topic:226535”]Well, ive been looking for a few days to port forward on my O2 Wireless Box II tried portforward.com aswell, and it seems its pretty much like taking a long walk off a short pier… well anyways, when i do “Attempt” to forward my port it comes up as.

Protocol: UDP/TCP/ANY (i know this part)
Port Range “43594” to “43592” im assuming
Translate to: Now what the hell is this, with my old router ive never had this, and i dont even have a clue what this is tbh.
Trigger Protocol, UDP/TCP/ANY
Trigger port, 43592 im assuming…

Screenshot:

Well, i dont know what the translate part is, ive tried putting my port in the translate part aswell asuming that because there is only a 5 char limit in the box.

Then its asking for to assign a game/application to a device, it has a list of the devices that are connected to my router atm, and i know the “home” one is my laptop which im going to be hosting on (is wireless connected, dunno if this relys on anything)
uPnP which i keep enabled i think, well i cant do anything really without it on, i.e; cant connect to other peoples host on xbl etc.

Screenshot #2:
Well im pretty stumped now. I have Windows Firewall turned off and the ports enabled in the exceptions both UDP and TCP.
Any help would be appriciated. Thanks :D[/quote]

Port 43592 is a non-existant port, you donut.

Read full topic

item.title: [REQ]Port Forwarding... *sigh*
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

The port range is 43594-43594 not 43592. And try just putting 43594 in all the spots where you have 43592.

Read full topic
